meanings.definition: Viewing one's own culture as superior to others.
meanings.sent1: An ethnocentric attitude can lead to misunderstandings between different cultures.
meanings.sent2: Her ethnocentric beliefs made it challenging for her to appreciate the customs of other societies.
meanings.sent3: The ethnocentric tourist insisted that their way of doing things was the only correct way.
meanings.sent4: His ethnocentric mindset acted as a barrier to truly understanding and respecting diverse cultures.
meanings.sent5: The professor's lecture on ethnocentric behavior opened the students' eyes to the dangers of cultural bias.

meanings.definition: Believing in the inherent superiority of one's own ethnic group.
meanings.sent1: The ethnocentric group refused to consider ideas from other communities.
meanings.sent2: She displayed an ethnocentric behavior that alienated those from different backgrounds.
meanings.sent3: The ethnocentric chef thought only their cuisine was worthy of praise.
meanings.sent4: His ethnocentric views blinded him to the richness of diversity around him.
meanings.sent5: The ethnocentric politician's speeches often stirred up feelings of division and exclusion.

meanings.definition: Judging other cultures based on the standards of one's own culture.
meanings.sent1: The ethnocentric of the group led them to dismiss traditions they didn't understand.
meanings.sent2: It's important to recognize and challenge ethnocentric tendencies in our own thinking.
meanings.sent3: The ethnocentric movie character comically tried to impose their cultural norms on everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her ethnocentric perspective prevented her from appreciating the beauty of diverse customs.
meanings.sent5: The ethnocentric behavior of the company executives hindered their ability to connect with global markets.
